item.title: All Rogue Set Part Locations in Dying Light: The Beast
item.description:
In Dying Light: The Beast , you will need to collect materials, weapons, and all sorts of other important items from the world map. If you want to be as successful as possible, you will also want to pick up one of the many armor sets that will give a bonus to your playstyle.

One such armor set in Dying Light: The Beast is the Rogue set. It helps to boost your stealth, add to your backstabbing damage, and it looks pretty cool as well. There are six total pieces of this armor, and you won't want to miss a single one.

All Rogue Armor Set Locations (Map)

The six pieces are located in six completely different locations, which means you'll need to do a lot of running and dodge a lot of different zombies in Dying Light: The Beast . If you want to make sure you get all the pieces, you can find them in the locations detailed below with helpful videos.

Rogue Fingerless Gloves

The Rogue Fingerless Gloves are found at the marked location inside a house with the door broken off and lying on the ground.

Rogue Leather Facemask

The facemask is located inside one of the many safes in Dying Light: The Beast . The video above shows how to find the combination required to open it.

Rogue Arm Guard

The Rogue Arm Guard is found in a secret room behind a bookshelf at the marked location.

Rogue Pants

The Rogue Pants require a number of steps, so definitely refer to the video above to find them.

Rogue Jacket

When picking up the Rogue jacket, make sure to get all the UV Light Sticks hidden in this locked office as well. These are very valuable items, especially at night.

Rogue Boots

The Rogue Boots requires a fresh fuse in a nearby fuse box, so check the video above for where to find the replacement.

All Rogue Armor Set Stats

The Dying Light: The Beast armor called the Rogue set has a facemask, pants, boots, gloves, a shirt, and arm wraps. Each boosts your ability to sneak up on enemies to strike before they know what hit them.

item.title: Best Games Where You Go To Heaven
item.description:
Depictions of Hell are fairly common in video games, with titles like Doom and Dante's Inferno being easy mentions here. While this doesn't mean that Heaven hasn't been depicted in such a manner, most people will agree that Hell is far more prominent in the realm of video games.

This is why any game that lets players explore a version of Heaven is tantalizing. Their take on this afterlife for people who haven't sinned sounds great, and fans will love to get their hands on any title that lets them explore Heaven in certain levels.

Valheim

The Main Goal Of The Game Is For Warriors To Earn Their Place In Valhalla

Valheim
8.7 /10
Released
February 2, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
r
Powered by

Valheim is taking over the survival genre by storm, and fans can't wait to see the waves its 1.0 release will make. Exploring various biomes, taking out bosses, and surviving with friends make for a grand time.

The main objective of this game is for players to prove themselves as warriors worthy of entering Valhalla, the afterlife for Nordic warriors. It's a great premise that gives players something to build toward as they try to help their playable character prove that they deserve to have a seat in this sought-after heaven.

Afterlife

The Demiurge Must Manage Both Heaven And Hell

Afterlife
City Builder
Strategy
Simulation
Systems
Released
January 1, 1996

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T // Comic Mischief, Suggestive Themes
Powered by

Players who want to enjoy a divine take on the city builder genre will love what Afterlife brings to the table. The old-school difficulty of this title will be hard to adjust to at first, but that shouldn't stop players from enjoying the novel gameplay of managing both heaven and hell.

It harkens back to the charm of classic LucasArts games, with players having to manage both realms for spirits who eventually come to reside there. For such a unique game, it's a shame that more people aren't aware of Afterlife 's divine charms.

Bayonetta

Paradiso Is This Game's Version Of Heaven

Bayonetta
8 /10
8.0 /10
Released
October 29, 2009

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Partial Nudity, Strong Language, Suggestive Themes
Powered by

Bayonetta is one of the most stylish action games players can check out. So, it's only fitting that the game's version of heaven is just as charming, if not more. Paradiso is the realm of angels and features some of the toughest enemies that Bayonetta must duke it out with.

The realm itself is very much a classic depiction of heaven, albeit with Bayonetta 's signature flair. It's one of the more memorable locations in the game that players will love to explore as they beat down aggressive angels in style.

Diablo 3

The Game's Fourth Act Takes Place In The High Heavens

Diablo 3
7 /10
8.1 /10
Released
September 3, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Violence
Powered by

After three scintillating acts where players get stronger and find better loot, the fourth act of Diablo 3 takes place in the High Heavens and is technically the final act of the base game. Players must journey to the High Heavens and free it from Diablo's demonic influence.

Preventing these demons from corrupting the realm and taking out Diablo in a bombastic boss fight makes for a great end to the main narrative. The High Heavens serve as a perfect staging ground for this climactic encounter and pulls no punches.

The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim

Exploring Sovngarde Is A Great Change Of Pace

The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim
9 /10
81
9.5 /10
Released
November 11, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes, Use of Alcohol
Powered by

Given that Skyrim is the realm of the Nords, it was only fitting for this game to feature its own take on Valhalla. This appears in the form of Sovngarde, a spiritual realm that makes for a beautiful location to explore in Skyrim .

It serves as a change of pace from the frosty Nordic lands, with the surreal visuals lending a sense of ethereal charm to Skyrim 's version of a heaven for worthy Nords. It's only fitting that this realm serves as the staging ground for the game's final boss fight against Alduin.

Neon White

Players Control A Neon Who Must Clean Up Heaven By Taking Out Demons At A Blistering Pace

Neon White
10 /10
Released
June 16, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Fantasy Violence, Language, Mild Blood, Mild Suggestive Themes, Use of Tobacco
Powered by

Speedrunning fanatics will get a kick out of playing Neon White , a game that prioritizes momentum and quick kills over everything else. Neons are sinners from Hell who are tasked with taking out demons in Heaven, doing so in scintillating levels where time is against them.

Using cards as either traversal maneuvers or weapon attacks is a fun balancing act that makes Neon White a tantalizing experience for players to sink their teeth into. Over time, players will become masters of the game's mechanics and make quick work of every level in style.

Super Paper Mario

A Charming And Classic Take On Heaven

Super Paper Mario
7.5 /10
Released
April 9, 2007

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
E For Everyone Due To Comic Mischief, Mild Cartoon Violence
Powered by

In classic Mario fashion, the version of heaven present in Super Paper Mario is as goofy as they come. Overthere is this game's version of heaven, which serves as a contrast to the underworld, which is hilariously called Underwhere.

It's an obvious depiction of heaven that doesn't leave anything to interpretation. The cloudy state of heaven is very popular and depicted gracefully in what is the best-selling Paper Mario game of all time.

Final Fantasy 2

The Additional Soul Of Rebirth Storyline Sees Players Invade The Light Emperor's Castle In Heaven

Final Fantasy II
8.0 /10
Released
December 17, 1988

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
t
Powered by

The Dawn of Souls remake of Final Fantasy 2 expands on the story after players beat the hellish version of The Emperor's revived form, who wishes to take over the world with his army of demons. Fittingly enough, the final dungeon of the Soul of Rebirth storyline takes place in heaven.

More specifically, the dungeon that players must explore this time is Arubboth, a palace in heaven. Rejecting the Light Emperor's promises and giving him one final death marked the end of Firion, Maria, Leon, and Guy's adventures.

item.title: Best Games Where You Build A Deck Of Powerful Cards
item.description:
There is just something so deeply, endlessly addictive about watching a deck of cards you've so carefully, so painstakingly pieced together just spin into beautiful, devastating motion. Every single choice, every gamble on a risky card, every beautiful little scrap of synergy players have managed to find...it all builds toward that one, perfect, glorious moment, where a single hand just dismantles an opponent like a finely-tuned clockwork machine.

These are the games that take that brilliant core idea and just push it even further, weaving in stories, brilliant new mechanics, and wonderful roguelike twists, until the simple act of drawing the next card feels like pulling the trigger of fate itself.

Slay The Spire

Climbing The Tower, One Perfect Shuffle At A Time

Slay the Spire
9 /10
10
9.4 /10
Released
January 23, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Fantasy Violence, Mild Blood, Tobacco Reference
Developer(s)
Mega Crit
Platform(s)
Android, iOS, PC, Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 4, Xbox One
Powered by

This is the blueprint. The one that so many other brilliant deckbuilders have studied, learned from, and built upon. Every single run up that spire is an ever-shifting, ever-changing puzzle, forcing players to constantly adapt their strategies on the fly. One moment, they’re a master of a thousand cuts, stacking up a mountain of poison as the Silent. Next, they’re a lumbering giant, building a fortress of pure block with the Ironclad.

And what makes the game stick is how no two decks ever feel the same. The relics players find will throw these wild, beautiful wrinkles into the best-laid plans. The enemies will punish predictable patterns. And victory, glorious victory, will always come down to whether one's choices, gambles, and desperate, last-minute pivots all come together to form a cohesive, beautiful, world-destroying machine.

Monster Train

A Train That Never, Ever Stops Running

Monster Train
Roguelike
Deckbuilding
Systems
Released
May 21, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Fantasy Violence, Mild Language, Alcohol Reference
Platform(s)
iOS, PC, Switch, Xbox One
Powered by

All aboard the Hell-bound express. Monster Train took the brilliant Slay the Spire formula and then just…stretched it. Vertically. Across three different floors of beautifully chaotic, strategic battles. And suddenly, one's deckbuilding isn't just about chaining together powerful card synergies; it's also about where players physically place their demonic units and how they defend their precious, glowing Pyre at the top of the train. The result is a game that feels like this perfect, beautiful, frantic mix of card play and tower defense.

Every clan that players choose introduces a wildly different flavor, from demons who literally thrive on death to angels who can scale their stats endlessly with buffs. Runs will spiral into a beautiful chaos as players' decks fill with units, spells, and relics that will all interact in ways they could never have possibly planned for.

Inscryption

The Deckbuilder That Isn't At All What It Seems

Inscryption
8.8 /10
Released
October 19, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood, Strong Language, Violence
Developer(s)
Daniel Mullins Games
Platform(s)
PC, PS4, PS5
Powered by

This game is a trip. A dark, twisted, and utterly unforgettable trip. At first, Inscryption just masquerades as a creepy, atmospheric, woodland card game, with its mysterious, shadowy opponent staring at players from across a rickety wooden table. The deckbuilding mechanics will feel familiar enough at first, with sacrifices and resource management dictating every move. And then…the game starts to peel back its layers.

The sheer brilliance of it is how it makes players feel so complicit in its twisted little game. Cards will start to talk to them. The rules will bend and break. New mechanics will just appear out of nowhere and completely rewrite strategies on the spot. Few games have ever made the simple act of building a deck feel so alive, so fragile, and so deeply unsettling.

Griftlands

Politics, Punches, And Playing The Long, Beautiful Game

Griftlands
RPG
Indie Games
Adventure
Strategy
Systems
Released
July 11, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
t
Developer(s)
Klei Entertainment
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, Xbox One, PlayStation 4, Linux, Microsoft Windows, macOS
Powered by

Griftlands is a game that puts negotiation and deckbuilding in the same room. Physical combat plays out with one deck. And arguments unfold with another. Players have to constantly weigh whether they want to win a situation through brute strength or through clever, cutting persuasion. The conversations here have real weight, and they will shape the storylines just as much as the battles will.

The writing is so, so sharp. The characters are vibrant, and the branching storylines ensure that the decks feel completely tied to one's choices, not just to the luck of the draw. There is this wonderful feeling of playing a long con, of stacking decks with cards that will slowly but surely wear down your enemies or rivals, until they're boxed into a corner that they can't escape.

Balatro

All In On Pure, Unadulterated Chaos

Balatro
27
8.8 /10
Released
February 20, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ // Gambling Themes
Developer(s)
LocalThunk
Platform(s)
PC, PS4, PS5, Switch, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Android, iOS
Powered by

This isn't just a deckbuilder. It is a dangerously addictive substance. Balatro takes the familiar rules of poker, tears them to shreds, and then rebuilds them into one of the most brilliant and hypnotic deckbuilders ever made. Players aren't just aiming for a simple flush or a straight anymore. Oh no. They're stacking modifiers, game-breaking Jokers, and mind-bending multipliers, until one's humble hand explodes with numbers that break the screen.

There's no deep, complex lore. Just pure, beautiful momentum. Runs will often collapse in a spectacular ball of flames when your luck turns sour. But when the synergies finally line up, when that one perfect Joker appears at just the right moment…the sense of power borders on the absurd. Watching a single, humble hand snowball into millions of points is so intoxicating, so purely satisfying, that players will shuffle up and go again before the victory screen has even had a chance to fade.

Across The Obelisk

A Party-Based Spin On Deckbuilding

Across the Obelisk
Digital Card Game
Roguelike
Systems
Released
April 8, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
t
Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

The whole gang comes together for this one. Across the Obelisk is a game that combines the best parts of a traditional, party-based RPG adventure with the deep, strategic satisfaction of a deckbuilder. Players guide a party of four heroes through big, branching storylines, all while managing four unique, individual decks at the same time.

Each hero has their own specific role to play, so success will hinge entirely on one's ability to weave them all together into a seamless, beautiful engine of support, damage, and control. And the co-operative element sets it apart. Playing with your mates, debating which card you should draft next, and watching different strategies either clash or harmonize in beautiful, chaotic ways adds wonderful layers of tension and fun.

item.title: Ghost of Yotei’s Atsu Joins the Ranks of an Important PlayStation Exclusive Club
item.description:
Ghost of Yotei makes a lot of bold changes from its predecessor. Not only does the sequel jump 300 years ahead of Ghost of Tsuhsima , but it introduces a brand-new protagonist: Atsu. As the main character of Ghost of Yotei , Atsu had the difficult task of following Ghost of Tsushima 's Jin Sakai. The two are different in a lot of ways, and thankfully, her differences are a strength.

Atsu's different motivation and traits could have made Ghost of Yotei not feel like a Ghost of Tsushima sequel at all, but this definitely isn't the case. Ghost of Yotei and Ghost of Tsushima share one spirit, but Atsu's narrative allows the former to stand on its own. Even more exciting, Atsu is officially the newest addition to PlayStation's long list of compelling main characters, but she also continues an important trend for the console: she adds to the growing roster of complex female leads.

Ghost of Yotei's Atsu Adds Another Great Female Protagonist to PlayStation's Ranks

PlayStation's Past Decade Has Put Compelling Women in the Spotlight

Of course, male leads like God of War 's Kratos, Nathan Drake in Uncharted 4 , Peter Parker and Miles Morales in Marvel's Spider-Man , and Days Gone 's Deacon St. John have helped build the past decade of PlayStation, too. However, these past 10 years have also been defined by wonderfully written stories led by women.

Female characters are nothing new in gaming. Lara Croft, Samus Aran, Jill Valentine, and Cortana are just the tip of the iceberg. The big difference with this past decade, though, is that the writing for these characters has gotten much stronger, and it seems to be a prevalent trend in PlayStation exclusives.

PlayStation's Most Notable Female Leads of the Past Decade

  • Aloy ( Horizon franchise)
  • Chloe Frazer ( Uncharted: The Lost Legacy )
  • Ellie ( The Last of Us Part 2 )
  • Abby ( The Last of Us Part 2 )
  • Selene Vassos ( Returnal )
  • Atsu ( Ghost of Yotei )

This is a solid list that Atsu is now part of, and it's also an exciting glimpse of how complex women leads have become in gaming. What's so great about these characters is that they are far from perfect. Chloe Frazer is witty and lovable, but she's also reckless and selfish. Aloy is a strong and resourceful character, but she's arrogant. Ellie and Abby's stories in The Last of Us Part 2 continue to spark debate among fans, because they are probably some of the most morally complicated dual protagonists to grace the industry. When it comes to Selene, her intelligence and drive are a key part of her, but her detachment from her son is also a defining characteristic.

At the beginning of Ghost of Yotei , Atsu starts off as bitter, overcome by anger due to the murder of her family. However, as her journey for revenge draws closer to an end, she grows softer, allowing herself to open up to others. One of Ghost of Yotei 's biggest differences from its predecessor is that it replaces Jin's struggle between honor and survival and opts for a story about not just revenge, but healing as well.

Female characters are nothing new in gaming. Lara Croft, Samus Aran, Jill Valentine, and Cortana are just the tip of the iceberg.

PlayStation Has Another Intriguing Woman-Led Story in the Pipeline

  • Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet (TBD)

Right now, the main PS5 exclusives on the way are Saros , Marvel's Wolverine , and Intergalactic . As Naughty Dog's first new IP in years, the story is led by bounty hunter Jordan A. Mun. The game is still shrouded in mystery, but the reveal at last year's Game Awards was a thrilling announcement. Only time will tell when Intergalactic is ready for launch, but once it is, Jordan can join Atsu as the new female protagonist on the block.

9.7 /10
10 /10

Ghost of Yotei

item.title: Upcoming Nintendo Switch 2 Games (2025 & Beyond)
item.description:
Jump Links

  • Switch 2 Games Coming In October 2025
  • Switch 2 Games Coming In November 2025
  • Switch 2 Games Coming In December 2025
  • Upcoming 2025 Switch 2 Games With No Release Date
  • Switch 2 Games Coming In 2026 Or With No Release Year

Debuting in June 2025, the Nintendo Switch 2 is slowly but surely building up its library, a process that has barely started but is already quite exciting. At this point, the Switch 2 games calendar is not overly stuffed with releases, with most weeks including only a couple of newcomers; however, new titles are announced quite frequently, and there should always be something on the horizon that could tempt you to take out your wallet.

The gaming industry never sleeps, so keeping track of every upcoming Switch 2 game can be exhausting. Consequently, we've put together a breakdown of all the projects slated to launch on the console, and we are referring exclusively to native releases and not backward-compatible Switch titles. What are some upcoming 2025 Switch 2 games? Which title will define 2026?

The focus is on Switch 2 games confirmed for North America. Japanese-only releases will not be included, unless they are confirmed to be coming to the West.

Updated on October 4, 2025, by Mark Sammut: Not too many new Switch games were revealed over the last week, but the following titles were added to the calendar: Fantasy Life i: The Girl Who Steals Time - The Sinister Broker Bazario's Schemes , Yakuza Kiwami 3 & Dark Ties , Dynasty Warriors 3 Complete Edition Remastered , Depth Loop , D-topia , Demi and the Fractured Dream.

Switch 2 Games Coming In October 2025

Pokemon, Borderlands, Persona, Dragon Quest, & More

While still early days, October 2025 looks primed and ready to be dominated by JRPGs. Pokemon Legends: Z-A 's pre-release marketing has attracted quite a bit of criticism, but it will still probably be one of the best-selling Switch 2 games of the year. Dragon Quest I & II HD-2D Remake should be a great throwback to classic turn-based JRPGs. Persona 3 Reload is also confirmed to be coming to the Switch 2, making October 2025 a brilliant month for JRPGs.

If you are looking for a creepy puzzle-platformer, Little Nightmares 3 should have you covered, and it even supports co-op. Besides the new game, the original title is also receiving an enhanced edition. Borderlands 4 is coming to the Switch 2 a bit late, which will hopefully allow for a smooth launch. During the September 12 Nintendo Direct, Super Mario Galaxy + Super Mario Galaxy 2 was announced, which is incredibly exciting.

  • October 2: Super Mario Galaxy + Super Mario Galaxy 2
  • October 3: Borderlands 4
  • October 3 : Castle of Heart: Retold
  • October 9: Yooka-Replaylee
  • October 10: Disgaea 7 Complete
  • October 10: Little Nightmares: Enhanced Edition
  • October 10: Little Nightmares 3
  • October 14: Just Dance 2026 Edition
  • October 15 : BALL x PIT
  • October 16 : Pokemon Legends: Z-A
  • October 23 : Full Metal Schoolgirl
  • October 23: Persona 3 Reload
  • October 23: Plants vs Zombies: Replanted
  • October 28: Two Point Museum
  • October 30: Dragon Quest I & II HD-2D Remake
  • October 30 : Majogami
  • October 30: Mortal Kombat: Legacy Kollection
  • October 31: Mina the Hollower

Switch 2 Games Coming In November 2025

Hyrule Warriors, Kirby, Dragon Ball, Yakuza, & More

So far, November 2025's Switch 2 games lineup is shaping up pretty nicely, with a mix of ports and new games. Dragon Ball: Sparking! Zero and Yakuza Kiwami have been out for a while (or a long time in the latter's case), but they are still big deals.

Kirby Air Riders is one of the Switch 2's most highly anticipated exclusives; however, it no longer has to carry November on its own as Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment will start the month on a huge note. The Musou game should be pretty awesome, as its predecessors were both a lot of fun.

  • November: Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP
  • November 6: Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment
  • November 7 : Anima Gate of Memories: I & II Remastered
  • November 11: Goodnight Universe
  • November 13 : Atelier Ryza Secret Trilogy Deluxe Pack
  • November 13: Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road
  • November 13: Yakuza Kiwami
  • November 13: Yakuza Kiwami 2
  • November 14: Dragon Ball: Sparking! Zero
  • November 18 : SpongeBob SquarePants: Titans of the Tide
  • November 20: Kirby Air Riders

Switch 2 Games Coming In December 2025

Metroid Prime 4, Octopath Traveler 0, & More

OK, it is finally happening! Metroid Prime 4 is coming. This is not a drill. The Nintendo Direct on September 12 revealed that the long-awaited, long-desired sequel has an official release date, and it could very well be the biggest release of the final few months of the year.

  • December 4: Metroid Prime 4: Beyond
  • December 4: Octopath Traveler 0

Upcoming 2025 Switch 2 Games With No Release Date

Elden Ring: Tarnished Edition & More

The Nintendo Switch 2 calendar for 2025 is still slightly open, and the console has a range of titles that are targeting debuts before the end of the year. Now, we cannot guarantee that will be the case until release dates for the Nintendo Switch 2 versions are announced. Ultimately, developers should take all the time they need to ensure they deliver the best iterations of each title, and rushing them out will do nobody any good.

  • AFL 26
  • Detective Dotson
  • Elden Ring: Tarnished Edition
  • Fantasy Life i: The Girl Who Steals Time - The Sinister Broker Bazario's Schemes
  • FUR Squadron Phoenix
  • Glaclered
  • Marvel Cosmic Invasion
  • Mouse Work
  • Obakeidoro 2: Chase & Seek
  • One Piece: Pirate Warriors 4
  • OPUS: Prism Peak
  • Overcooked! 2
  • Paper Sky
  • Popucom
  • Professor Layton and the New World of Steam
  • The Rogue Prince of Persia
  • Skate Story
  • Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds
  • Stardew Valley
  • Ultimate Sheep Raccoon
  • Witchbrook

Switch 2 Games Coming In 2026 Or With No Release Year

Fire Emblem, Duskbloods, Final Fantasy 7, & More

The Switch 2's life has only just begun, and its future is bright but also mostly in shadow. What upcoming 2026 Switch 2 games will define the year? Will it be FromSoftware's The Duskbloods ? Maybe Fire Emblem: Fortune's Weave ? How about a new Mario Tennis ?

There is, frankly, a huge chance that the biggest Switch 2 game of 2026 has yet to be revealed, which means that exciting times are ahead. Consoles tend to get things going with a few slow years that feature splashes of major releases rather than consistent output, so the Switch 2's immediate future could be a bit slow.

  • January 15, 2026: The Legend of Heroes: Trails beyond the Horizon
  • January 22, 2026: Dynasty Warriors: Origins
  • January 22, 2026: Final Fantasy VII Remake Intergrade
  • February 5, 2026: DRAGON QUEST VII Reimagined
  • February 12, 2026: Mario Tennis Fever
  • February 12, 2026: Yakuza Kiwami 3 & Dark Ties
  • February 27, 2026: Resident Evil 7: biohazard - Gold Edition
  • February 27, 2026: Resident Evil Requiem
  • February 27, 2026: Resident Evil Village Gold Edition
  • March 13, 2026: Monster Hunter Stories 3: Twisted Reflection
  • March 19, 2026: Dynasty Warriors 3 Complete Edition Remastered
  • March 27, 2026: 007 First Light
  • The Adventures of Elliot: The Millennium Tales
  • Aurascope
  • Back to the Dawn
  • Bestiario
  • Blood: Refreshed Supply
  • Changer Seven
  • Content Warning
  • Cookie Clicker
  • D-topia
  • Danganronpa 2x2
  • Demi and the Fractured Dream
  • Depth Loop
  • The Duskbloods
  • Enter the Gungeon 2
  • Fatal Frame II: Crimson Butterfly Remake
  • Farming Simulator: Signature Edition
  • Fire Emblem: Fortune's Weave
  • Hela
  • Human: Fall Flat 2
  • Indiana Jones and the Great Circle
  • The Legend of Dark Witch Episode 4: Thoughts Delivered
  • Lego Batman: Legacy of the Dark Knight
  • Maseylia: Echoes of the Past
  • My Time at Evershine
  • Pokemon Pokopia
  • PowerWash Simulato r 2
  • Pritto Prisoner
  • Reanimal
  • Spine
  • Starbites
  • Starseeker: Astroneer Expeditions
  • Suika Game Planet
  • Super Mario Bros. Wonder: Nintendo Switch 2 Edition + Meetup in Bellabel Park
  • Tails of Fate
  • Virtua Fighter 5 R.E.V.O
  • Yoshi and the Mysterious Book
  • Ys X: Proud Nordics
